description: User provides origin, destination, date, passengers, cabin class, and preferences in the first message. Agent confirms, offers add-ons, and summarizes.
goal: Complete a one-way flight booking successfully
name: One-way booking with complete details
policy: Knowledge Article: Simulated Flight Booking (One-way / Complete Details)
Overview: Provide a realistic end-to-end booking conversation while clearly operating in a simulated environment.
Supported: Ask for/confirm origin, destination, date, passenger count, cabin, baggage, seat/meal preferences; present plausible estimated options; collect contact and payment inputs.
Supported: Confirm a simulated booking and provide a realistic fake record locator/confirmation code.
Not supported: Real-time inventory/pricing checks, live seat maps, guaranteed specific seats/meals, fee waivers, or any claim of completing a real transaction.
If unsupported is requested: Clearly refuse ("I can’t do that"), explain why (policy limitation), and offer policy-compliant alternatives (estimates, flexible dates, different cabin/route).

description: User wants a round trip but omits key details (dates or return city). Agent asks clarifying questions and iterates.
goal: Collect missing details and complete a round-trip booking successfully
name: Round-trip booking with missing info
policy: Knowledge Article: Round-trip Booking with Missing Information (Clarification-Driven)
Overview: Drive the conversation to completion by gathering missing details while keeping the interaction realistic and efficient.
Supported: Ask targeted clarifying questions (dates, airports, times, stops, passenger details); propose reasonable defaults only with explicit user confirmation.
Supported: Offer plausible estimated options and then confirm a simulated booking with a fake record locator.
Not supported: Any claim of live fare/availability checks or completing a real purchase; do not guarantee prices or inventory.
If unsupported is requested: Refuse and suggest alternatives (e.g., provide an estimate range, broaden time window, allow 1 stop, adjust dates).

description: User is flexible on dates and wants the cheapest option. Agent asks for constraints (time windows, max stops) and proposes tradeoffs.
goal: Propose options and complete the booking (or confirm the selection) successfully
name: Flexible dates, find cheapest
policy: Knowledge Article: Flexible-Date Fare Shopping (Budget Optimization)
Overview: Help the user decide among tradeoffs (time vs stops vs price) using estimated information.
Supported: Ask constraints (time window, max stops, airports, baggage); provide plausible estimated options and explain tradeoffs.
Supported: If the user selects an option, confirm a simulated booking and provide a fake record locator.
Not supported: Guaranteeing the absolute cheapest fare, holding fares, or claiming live pricing/inventory.
If unsupported is requested: Refuse and propose alternatives (widen date window, accept 1 stop, change airport, adjust cabin).

description: User needs multi-city travel (e.g., NYC→LON→PAR→NYC). Agent gathers segment dates, time preferences, and constraints.
goal: Gather segment details and complete a multi-city booking successfully
name: Multi-city itinerary
policy: Knowledge Article: Multi-city Itinerary Planning (Estimated Options)
Overview: Plan a complex itinerary by collecting segment-by-segment requirements and presenting plausible estimated options.
Supported: Collect segment dates/times, preferred connection limits, baggage needs; propose estimated connections and constraints.
Supported: Confirm a simulated booking for the chosen itinerary and provide a fake record locator.
Not supported: Live availability checks, guarantees about protected connections/through-ticketing, or claims of real purchase.
If unsupported is requested: Refuse and offer alternatives (simplify route, adjust dates, add connection flexibility, split into separate tickets as an option with caveats).

description: User travels for work and must follow a policy (budget cap, preferred airlines, max stops). Agent ensures compliance and offers alternatives.
goal: Find a policy-compliant itinerary and complete the booking successfully
name: Business booking with policy constraints
policy: Knowledge Article: Corporate Travel Booking (Policy/Constraint Compliance)
Overview: Produce an itinerary recommendation that respects corporate constraints and document tradeoffs transparently.
Supported: Enforce stated rules (budget cap, preferred airlines, max stops, cabin restrictions); propose estimated compliant options.
Supported: If the user approves, confirm a simulated booking and provide a fake record locator.
Not supported: Booking options that violate the stated constraints; guarantees of upgrades; claims of real-time corporate booking system access.
If unsupported/violating request occurs: Refuse and propose compliant alternatives (nearby airports, different times, 1 stop, policy exception request suggestion).

description: User starts with economy. Agent asks if they'd like to upgrade (premium economy/business) and explains benefits and tradeoffs.
goal: Complete the booking and resolve whether the user upgrades or stays in economy
name: Agent offers premium upgrade
policy: Knowledge Article: Cabin Upgrade Guidance (Upsell with Constraints)
Overview: Educate the user on cabin differences and capture an explicit decision without overpromising.
Supported: Explain benefits/tradeoffs of economy vs premium economy vs business; ask preference and budget constraints.
Supported: Confirm a simulated booking in the selected cabin and provide a fake record locator.
Not supported: Claims of live upgrade inventory, guaranteed upgrades, or free upgrades.
If unsupported is requested: Refuse and suggest alternatives (different dates, different carrier, flexible fare, paid upgrade ranges as estimates).

description: User cares about seat (aisle/window, extra legroom) and meal (vegetarian/halal). Agent confirms availability and captures preferences.
goal: Capture preferences and complete the booking successfully
name: Seat/meal preferences
policy: Knowledge Article: Seat & Meal Preference Handling (Request vs Guarantee)
Overview: Capture preferences as requests and set expectations about availability.
Supported: Ask seat/meal preferences; explain common options; record preferences as requests.
Supported: Confirm a simulated booking with a fake record locator and summarize recorded preferences.
Not supported: Live seat map access, guaranteeing specific seat numbers/meal availability.
If unsupported is requested: Refuse and suggest alternatives (request at booking, check-in early, flexible seating, contact airline).

description: User has additional bags (or overweight/oversize). Agent clarifies baggage needs and discusses typical fee considerations without quoting exact policy as factual.
goal: Clarify baggage needs and complete the booking successfully
name: Extra baggage / baggage fees
policy: Knowledge Article: Baggage Guidance (General Information Only)
Overview: Provide general baggage guidance and capture needs without presenting airline-specific rules as guaranteed.
Supported: Ask number/size/weight of bags; discuss typical fee considerations as estimates; suggest practical packing options.
Supported: Confirm a simulated booking with a fake record locator and state baggage rules vary by airline/fare.
Not supported: Quoting exact airline fees/rules as facts, waiving fees, or claiming policy exceptions.
If unsupported is requested: Refuse and offer alternatives (prepay baggage, choose fare with bags included, reduce bags/weight, different airline).

description: User is traveling with an infant. Agent asks about lap infant vs seat, stroller, and timing needs.
goal: Clarify infant travel requirements and complete the booking successfully
name: Traveling with infant
policy: Knowledge Article: Traveling with an Infant (Policy-Varies Guidance)
Overview: Collect infant travel details and provide respectful, policy-varies guidance.
Supported: Ask lap infant vs seat, infant age, stroller/car seat needs, timing considerations; note typical practices.
Supported: Confirm a simulated booking with a fake record locator and summarize infant-related requests.
Not supported: Guaranteeing airline-specific rules, fees, or acceptance.
If unsupported is requested: Refuse to guarantee; suggest alternatives (check airline policy, choose flexible fares, allow extra buffer, consider infant seat).

description: User asks about booking for a minor traveling alone. Agent requests age range and mentions that rules vary by airline; offers general guidance.
goal: Explain requirements and either proceed to booking steps or state limitations clearly
name: Unaccompanied minor
policy: Knowledge Article: Unaccompanied Minor Requests (Eligibility Not Guaranteed)
Overview: Provide general information and collect details while emphasizing airline-specific eligibility rules.
Supported: Ask age range, route, nonstop vs connection preference; explain that requirements vary by airline.
Supported: Simulate capturing the request and next steps (what information would be submitted).
Not supported: Guaranteeing acceptance, claiming enrollment in UMNR services, or completing real airline special-service bookings.
If unsupported is requested: Refuse and suggest alternatives (adult accompaniment, choose airlines/routes known to support UMNR, different itinerary).

description: User requests accessibility support. Agent collects assistance type and timing and ensures respectful language.
goal: Capture accessibility needs and complete the booking successfully
name: Wheelchair / accessibility assistance
policy: Knowledge Article: Accessibility Assistance Requests (Capture & Set Expectations)
Overview: Capture assistance needs and communicate that accommodations are subject to airline processes.
Supported: Ask for wheelchair type/assistance level, airport assistance needs, timing; provide general guidance respectfully.
Supported: Confirm a simulated booking with a fake record locator and summarize assistance requests.
Not supported: Guaranteeing specific accommodations or claiming direct control of airline accessibility operations.
If unsupported is requested: Refuse to guarantee; suggest alternatives (contact airline accessibility desk, arrive early, carry documentation if needed).

description: User wants to travel with a small pet. Agent asks for pet type/size and notes that policies vary by airline.
goal: Clarify pet details and either proceed with booking or state constraints clearly
name: Pet in cabin
policy: Knowledge Article: Pet-in-Cabin Requests (Policy-Varies)
Overview: Gather pet details and provide general guidance while clarifying that airline policies vary.
Supported: Ask pet type/size, carrier dimensions, route details; provide general guidelines and preparations.
Supported: Confirm a simulated booking with a fake record locator and state the pet request is subject to airline approval.
Not supported: Guaranteeing pet acceptance or quoting airline-specific limits as certain.
If unsupported is requested: Refuse to guarantee; suggest alternatives (pet-friendly airlines, different dates/routes, cargo options with caveats).

description: User books for a large group. Agent asks for passenger count, flexibility, and whether they need to sit together.
goal: Collect group requirements and conclude with a clear booking plan (or next steps)
name: Group booking
policy: Knowledge Article: Group Flight Booking (Coordination & Expectations)
Overview: Coordinate group requirements and provide a realistic plan without claiming access to airline group contracting.
Supported: Gather passenger count, flexibility, seat-together preference, baggage needs; propose estimated options and planning steps.
Supported: Simulate an itinerary selection and confirm a simulated booking/plan with a fake reference.
Not supported: Real-time group rate negotiations, blocking seats, or guaranteeing everyone sits together.
If unsupported is requested: Refuse and propose alternatives (book earlier, choose seats later, split across flights, relax constraints).

description: User asks to use points/miles. Agent clarifies program, flexibility, and offers a cash vs points comparison.
goal: Help the user choose points vs cash and conclude with a clear booking decision/next steps
name: Use miles/points
policy: Knowledge Article: Loyalty Points vs Cash Booking (High-Level Guidance)
Overview: Provide a cash vs points comparison using non-real-time, illustrative guidance.

Supported: Ask loyalty program and flexibility; discuss typical tradeoffs (availability, change rules, value-per-point). Supported: Summarize a recommended decision and next steps for completing booking via the appropriate channel.
Not supported: Accessing real-time award inventory, quoting exact redemption rates, or transferring points on the user's behalf.
If unsupported is requested: Refuse and suggest alternatives (check loyalty portal, contact program support, consider cash booking, widen dates).

description: User wants to change dates/times for an existing booking. Agent collects itinerary basics and desired change, and explains typical steps.
goal: Conclude with the change successfully processed or clearly explain why it cannot be done
name: Change existing booking
policy: Knowledge Article: Change/Rebooking Requests (No Direct Booking Access)
Overview: Provide change guidance and capture details while clarifying limitations.
Supported: Ask for booking reference, fare type/channel, desired new dates/times; explain typical change steps and considerations.
Supported: Simulate capturing the change request and summarize next steps.
Not supported: Accessing/modifying a real booking, guaranteeing fee waivers, or claiming the change was processed.
If unsupported is requested: Refuse and suggest alternatives (check fare rules, flexible fares, travel credits, contact airline/OTA).

description: User asks about canceling and refunds. Agent asks fare type and notes that policies vary; provides general guidance.
goal: Conclude with clear cancellation/refund guidance and next steps
name: Cancellation / refund inquiry
policy: Knowledge Article: Cancellation & Refund Guidance (Policy Varies)
Overview: Provide general guidance and set expectations about variability across airlines/fare types.
Supported: Ask fare type, booking channel, timing; explain typical refund vs credit outcomes as general guidance.
Supported: Simulate capturing the cancellation intent and summarize next steps.
Not supported: Guaranteeing refund eligibility/amounts or canceling a real booking.
If unsupported is requested: Refuse to guarantee; suggest alternatives (travel credits, rebooking, contacting airline/OTA, travel insurance).

description: User missed a connection or anticipates delay risk. Agent asks constraints and proposes safer itineraries or buffers.
goal: Conclude with a concrete rebooking/itinerary recommendation and next steps
name: Missed connection scenario
policy: Knowledge Article: Disruption Handling (Missed Connection / Delay Risk)
Overview: Provide safety-first guidance and recommended next steps without claiming real-time operational access.
Supported: Ask constraints; recommend buffers, earlier departures, fewer connections; provide general rebooking guidance.
Supported: Simulate capturing rebooking preferences and summarize recommended next steps.
Not supported: Accessing real-time disruption tools, rebooking in live systems, or guaranteeing compensation.
If unsupported is requested: Refuse and suggest alternatives (contact airline, consider travel insurance, choose itineraries with longer layovers).

description: User needs to correct passenger name. Agent requests exact mismatch and notes that policies vary.
goal: Conclude with the correction request captured and clear next steps
name: Name correction
policy: Knowledge Article: Passenger Name Correction (Policy Varies)
Overview: Capture the mismatch details and provide general next steps while clarifying variability.
Supported: Ask the exact incorrect vs correct name; explain typical correction pathways at a high level.
Supported: Simulate capturing the correction request and summarize next steps.
Not supported: Changing a real booking, guaranteeing acceptance, or guaranteeing a free correction.
If unsupported is requested: Refuse and suggest alternatives (contact airline support, check fare rules, reissue/refund where allowed).

description: User has a payment issue (card declined) or requests pay-later options. Agent troubleshoots and offers alternatives.
goal: Either successfully complete payment and booking, or clearly fail due to payment issues and provide alternatives
name: Payment failure / alternative payment
policy: Knowledge Article: Payment Authorization Failure (Booking Not Completed)
Overview: When payment fails, the booking must not be confirmed; focus on troubleshooting and alternatives.
Supported: Ask for the error context; suggest troubleshooting (verify billing address, funds, bank blocks) and alternative payment methods.
Supported: Clearly state booking could not be completed due to authorization failure and propose next steps.
Not supported: Claiming payment succeeded, bypassing bank authorization, or confirming booking despite failure.
If unsupported is requested: Refuse and suggest alternatives (different card, pay-later option, call bank, try another payment channel).

description: User needs a flight urgently (same day / next day). Agent prioritizes constraints, confirms flexibility, and summarizes.
failure_reason: No flights available that match the requested constraints
goal: Attempt to book a last-minute flight; if no suitable flights exist, clearly explain unavailability and propose alternatives
name: Last-minute booking
policy: Knowledge Article: Last-Minute Booking Attempt (Unavailability Handling)
Overview: Handle urgent requests by clarifying constraints and, if unavailable, failing gracefully with alternatives.
Supported: Propose plausible estimated options and explain tradeoffs; if outcome is failure, do not confirm booking.
Supported: Clearly explain why constraints cannot be met and provide at least two alternatives (time/date, nearby airports, add a stop, cabin change).
Not supported: Real-time availability checks, forcing sold-out flights, or confirming booking when outcome is failure.
If unsupported is requested: Refuse and reiterate available alternatives within policy.

description: User has very strict constraints (specific time window, nonstop only, tight budget). Agent searches plausibly, cannot find matching options, and offers near-miss alternatives.
failure_reason: No available itinerary meets the constraints (time window / nonstop / budget)
goal: Fail gracefully due to unavailability under strict constraints and propose workable alternatives
name: No flights match strict constraints
policy: Knowledge Article: No Options Match Strict Constraints (Graceful Failure)
Overview: When constraints cannot be satisfied, clearly explain the mismatch and propose workable alternatives.
Supported: Evaluate constraints; propose near-miss alternatives (relax time window, allow 1 stop, nearby airports, higher budget) using estimates.
Supported: Clearly state failure/unavailability and present at least two alternatives; ask which alternative the user prefers.
Not supported: Real-time search claims, overriding inventory, or confirming booking when outcome is failure.
If unsupported is requested: Refuse and restate policy-compliant alternatives.
